contentHtml:
Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

Assume you have a string sss where you need to return a substring without duplicate characters.

  • s="pwwkew"s = "pwwkew"s="pwwkew"
    • Output:3Output: 3Output:3
      • "wke""wke""wke" and "kew""kew""kew" are the longest strings.
      • You cannot return "pwke""pwke""pwke" because there is a duplicate "w""w""w" which means it is not a substring. Rather, it is a subsequence.

How to Solve?

Notice how a repeating character immediately makes it impossible to extend the string.

With the string s="pwwkew"s = "pwwkew"s="pwwkew", we have to eliminate the "pw""pw""pw" before calculating "wke""wke""wke".

What if we had some method of removing characters up until that point?

Sliding Window

We can create a sliding window where we set the left and right pointers to the beginning of a string. We know that one character has a length of 1.

How do we find out if a character is repeating? You can do this by creating a hash set.

    • (r−l+1)=2(r - l + 1) = 2(r−l+1)=2
  • charSet={"p"}charSet = \{"p"\}charSet={"p"}
  • Increment rrr since "p""p""p" was not previously in charSetcharSetcharSet

  • Don't iterate anymore since rrr is at the end of the list.

Simply, return the max length.

Helpful Hints

  • Create a hash set.
    • charSet=set()charSet = set()charSet=set()
  • How to remove from a set?
    • remove()remove()remove()
  • How to add to a set?
    • add()add()add()
  • How to get the max?
    • max(x,y)max(x, y)max(x,y)

Sliding Window Solution

class Solution:
    def lengthOfLongestSubstring(self, s: str) -> int:
        # Set a left pointer to 0
        l = 0
        # Set the current max length to 0
        maxLength = 0
        # Create a character set
        charSet = set()

        # Iterate r from 0 to the end of the list
        for r in range(len(s)):
            # Remove s[l] from charSet
            # Until there are no more duplicates
            # Of the value of s[r]
            while s[r] in charSet:
                charSet.remove(s[l])
                # Increment left pointer to remove
                # Next value in charSet
                l += 1

            # Get the max length of the substring
            # While s[r] is not in charSet
            maxLength = max(maxLength, (r - l + 1))

            # Add s[r] to the charSet
            charSet.add(s[r])
        
        return maxLength
title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
